title: Index
description: A database index for query optimization. SQL 2016 does not standardize index creation syntax (it is implementation-defined); the 'unique' and 'columns' attributes represent standard concepts, while 'method', 'include', and 'where' are vendor-specific extensions.

method.description: PostgreSQL-specific index access method (e.g., BTREE, HASH, GIN, GIST, SPGIST, BRIN). Vendor extension — not part of SQL 2016.

where.description: Partial index predicate (SQL expression). Only rows satisfying this condition are included in the index. Vendor extension supported by PostgreSQL and others.

include.description: Covering index: additional columns included in the index leaf pages but not in the search key. Available in PostgreSQL 11+ and SQL Server. Vendor extension — not part of SQL 2016.
